radiographic_examinations.findings: Focal wall thickening and inflammatory stranding in the sigmoid colon with a focal outpouching, several small adjacent foci of fluid, and an adjacent punctate foci of air. Lung bases are clear, unremarkable heart, focal fatty infiltration at the ligamentum teres Hepatis, simple cyst in the peripheral right lobe of the liver, normal gallbladder, and normal appearance of pancreas, spleen, adrenal glands, large and small bowel. No free fluid or free air in the abdomen. Sclerotic foci in L1 and T11 vertebral bodies.
